description_for_human: Streamlines consultant assignment and time management.
description_for_model: The Trey Research plugin allows locating consultants by skills, roles, certifications, and availability, as well as charging hours and assigning consultants to projects.

functions.name: getUserInformation
functions.description: Retrieve the consultant profile including skills, roles, certifications, location, availability, and project assignments.

reasoning.instructions:
- Decide whether to invoke `getUserInformation()`:
    - Check the last user message in the `conversation_memory` and the tool invocation history in the `turn_memory`:
    - Based on the `result` from `turn_memory`, do I need to return a consultant information to answer the user message accurately? If so, invoke `getUserInformation()`. If no parameters are available, invoke `getUserInformation()` without any parameters.

responding.instructions: - Always show results in a paragraph with following columns: name, email, phone, skills, roles, certifications.

functions.name: getProjects
functions.description: Returns detailed information about projects matching the specified project name and/or consultant name

consultantName.description: The name of the consultant assigned to the project

projectName.description: The name of the project or name of the client.

reasoning.description: # `getProjects(consultantName: str, projectName: str) -> str` Returns detailed information about projects matching the specified project name and/or consultant name.
reasoning.instructions:
- Decide whether to invoke `getProjects(consultantName: str, projectName: str)`:
    - Check the last user message in the `conversation_memory` and the tool invocation history in the `turn_memory`:
    - Based on the `result` from `turn_memory`, do I need to return a list of projects to answer the user message accurately? If so, invoke `getProjects(consultantName: str, projectName: str) `. If any of the parameters is not available do not pass the specific parameter. All parameters are optional. If no parameters are available, invoke `getProjects()` without any parameters.
* here are the descriptions for parameters:
   - consultantName (str): The name of the consultant assigned to the project
   - projectName (str): The name of the project or name of the client.

responding.instructions: - Always show results in a tabular form with following columns: name,description, clientName, clientContact, location

functions.name: getConsultants
functions.description: Returns detailed information about consultants identified from filters like name of the consultant, name of project, certifications, skills, roles and hours available. Multiple filters can be used in combination to refine the list of consultants returned

consultantName.description: Name of the consultant to retrieve

skill.description: Skills for a consultant. Retrieve consultants with this skill

certification.description: Certification for a consultant. Retrieve consultants with this certification

role.description: Role of a consultant. Retrieve consultants with this role

hoursAvailable.description: Hours a consultant is available for new work over this and next month. Please provide an integer value; for example 0 if no hours are available, 1 if any hours are available, or 20 if 20 or more hours are available.

functions.name: postBillhours
functions.description: Charge time to a specific project on behalf of the logged in user, and return the number of hours remaining in their forecast.

functions.name: postAssignConsultant
functions.description: Assign (add) consultant to a project when name, role and project name is specified.
